I just want men online to stop acting like unique little snowflakes who are the only one's on earth who have issues, relationship issues, or problems in the dating world, and are so put upon. We're all out here struggling---we're all simping in one way or another--none of us are getting laid anymore in the modern world. Men and Women both have problems, and a lot of the time, they're the same problem manifesting in different ways, stemming from the same core problem. And that problem is.....

The internet and media have convinced men and women we're natural enemies who have to fuck each other over, protect ourselves from the other side, constantly be suspicious and hateful, instead of working together, shoring up each other strengths and weaknesses. If we could stop pissing and moaning for 10 freaking minutes, we might realize we have a lot more in common than we think and that we actually want the same things.

body: The English is biased by translators who are very aware of our culture wars but know little about the world this was written in. "Man" is actually "strong man", some type of warrior or soldier. "Garment" is really fighting gear like armor. I'm not sure why this exists but like 90% of  this book it probably had some extremely specific reason which has since been forgotten. I would guess something to do with deceit, perhaps they had an international truce not to pull tricks like that on opposing forces (similar to how in recent history the world has mostly agreed to not attack on Sunday). But we'll probably never know, unless we get a time machine.

post.body:
> A woman shall not be clothed with man's apparel, neither shall a man use woman's apparel: for he that doeth these things is abominable before God.

Haydock comments on the passage (I think):

> God. Some take this literally, as the contrary practice is contrary to decency, and might be attended with very pernicious consequences. All know what noise was occasioned by the action of Clodius, who put on women's apparel, that he might be present with the Roman ladies at the feast of the good goddess. Yet others think that Moses here forbids some superstitious practices. 

> St. Ambrose (ep. 69,) remarks, that in some of the mysteries of the idols, it was requisite for those present to change clothes in this manner, sacrum putatur. Lucian testifies, that men put on women's clothes at the feasts of Bacchus. They did the like in those of Venus, while the women took men's clothes in the festivals of Mars. (Jul. Hirmic. c. 4.) (Maimonides) --- In the East, people honoured the moon, to which they attributed both sexes, and Venus in like manner. 

> Josephus ([Antiquities,?] iv.8,) believes that women are here prohibited to engage in warfare. Hebrew, "the vessels (armour) of man shall not be upon a woman." Semiramis gained a great name by her martial exploits, and commanded all her subjects to dress like herself. (Justin., i) --- The Amazons were likewise very famous in war, and it is said that half the army of Bacchus was composed of women. 

> Alb. Gentil maintains that Moses here condemns an abominable crime, which he did not wish to mention, at which the Book of Wisdom hints, (chap. xiv. 26,) and which St. Paul condemns more explicitly, Romans i. 26. 

> Moses had already denounced death against the perpetrators of it; and surely the manner in which he now speaks, seems to forbid something more than simply putting on the garments of the other sex, for he, &c. (Calmet) --- Yet that disorderly conduct deserved to be reprobated in strong terms, (Haydock) when it was not excused by some necessity or proper motive, such as actuated some holy virgins, St. Theodora, &c. (Tirinus)

Cross-dressing was also criminalized in various places throughout history.

(Justin., i) --- The Amazons were likewise very famous in war, and it is said that half the army of Bacchus was composed of women. 

> Alb. Gentil maintains that Moses here condemns an abominable crime, which he did not wish to mention, at which the Book of Wisdom hints, (chap. xiv. 26,) and which St. Paul condemns more explicitly, Romans i. 26. 

> Moses had already denounced death against the perpetrators of it; and surely the manner in which he now speaks, seems to forbid something more than simply putting on the garments of the other sex, for he, &c. (Calmet) --- Yet that disorderly conduct deserved to be reprobated in strong terms, (Haydock) when it was not excused by some necessity or proper motive, such as actuated some holy virgins, St. Theodora, &c. (Tirinus)

Cross-dressing was also criminalized in various places throughout history.
post.body_html:
A woman shall not be clothed with man's apparel, neither shall a man use woman's apparel: for he that doeth these things is abominable before God.

Haydock comments on the passage (I think):

God. Some take this literally, as the contrary practice is contrary to decency, and might be attended with very pernicious consequences. All know what noise was occasioned by the action of Clodius, who put on women's apparel, that he might be present with the Roman ladies at the feast of the good goddess. Yet others think that Moses here forbids some superstitious practices.

St. Ambrose (ep. 69,) remarks, that in some of the mysteries of the idols, it was requisite for those present to change clothes in this manner, sacrum putatur. Lucian testifies, that men put on women's clothes at the feasts of Bacchus. They did the like in those of Venus, while the women took men's clothes in the festivals of Mars. (Jul. Hirmic. c. 4.) (Maimonides) --- In the East, people honoured the moon, to which they attributed both sexes, and Venus in like manner.

Josephus ([Antiquities,?] iv.8,) believes that women are here prohibited to engage in warfare. Hebrew, "the vessels (armour) of man shall not be upon a woman." Semiramis gained a great name by her martial exploits, and commanded all her subjects to dress like herself. (Justin., i) --- The Amazons were likewise very famous in war, and it is said that half the army of Bacchus was composed of women.

Alb. Gentil maintains that Moses here condemns an abominable crime, which he did not wish to mention, at which the Book of Wisdom hints, (chap. xiv. 26,) and which St. Paul condemns more explicitly, Romans i. 26.

Moses had already denounced death against the perpetrators of it; and surely the manner in which he now speaks, seems to forbid something more than simply putting on the garments of the other sex, for he, &c. (Calmet) --- Yet that disorderly conduct deserved to be reprobated in strong terms, (Haydock) when it was not excused by some necessity or proper motive, such as actuated some holy virgins, St. Theodora, &c. (Tirinus)

Cross-dressing was also criminalized in various places throughout history.

parent.body:
> Some of the books are authentic, some are not. Some of the authentic ones are given far higher priority than they should be. And yes the church tampered with it to promote their agenda and reign in the original Christian movement. Especially the epistles of Paul. There is very clear evidence of it if you're willing to look. The Jewish priesthood tampered with the Old Testament the exact same way. Organized religion is a scam.

I maintain that this is untrue. I have researched arguments for a non-inerrant Bible, and I maintain that those arguments, along with those presented, do not refute the idea of an inerrant Bible. The reason I am engaging in this debate, despite rarely being on Ruqqus at all, is to hear arguments against the inerrancy of the Bible, since, respectfully, you constantly bring up for a point of conflict as an active member in this community. However, these supposed arguments are distinctly fallacious, and if someone casts doubt upon what they believed prior was God’s word based on weak claims, it would be an awful message on the stability of a believer’s faith.

Note: What I’m not saying is that “questioning popular belief is evidence that your faith is weak”. What I am saying is exactly what I said: If someone casts doubt upon what they believed prior was God’s word based on weak claims, it would be an awful message on the stability of a believer’s faith. As the claims so far has been weak or unpresented, I am led to think that is the case.

> And if the Bible is so authoritative, then why did God wait until a couple hundred years ago to reveal it?

The answer to this is the same to God’s “delay” in answering prayers and the like. It simply wouldn’t achieve His goal, or would achieve it in a subpar quality. Asking questions like “Couldn’t God just constantly form “I am God” in the clouds to make everyone know of his existence” ignores the extremely limited sight of human beings.

> As for sacrifices, why does the Psalm author say he would bring a sacrifice if God had pleasure in it? Yet the Torah specifically requires a sacrifice as atonement for sin, and claims it pleases God because of a "savory aroma". Every other place God looks favorably on sacrifice is as a thank you, like a Lent type thing, as you admit that he condemns it for other reasons. Yet the Torah also prescribes it for exactly those reasons.

I haven’t argued that God isn’t pleased with sacrifice. I said specifically, “and as God is pleased with us asking for forgiveness today, sacrifice was a method to repent when one fails God’s commands”. When has the Torah prescribed sacrifice for ignoring God’s commands?

I maintain that this is untrue. I have researched arguments for a non-inerrant Bible, and I maintain that those arguments, along with those presented, do not refute the idea of an inerrant Bible. The reason I am engaging in this debate, despite rarely being on Ruqqus at all, is to hear arguments against the inerrancy of the Bible, since, respectfully, you constantly bring up for a point of conflict as an active member in this community. However, these supposed arguments are distinctly fallacious, and if someone casts doubt upon what they believed prior was God’s word based on weak claims, it would be an awful message on the stability of a believer’s faith.

Note: What I’m not saying is that “questioning popular belief is evidence that your faith is weak”. What I am saying is exactly what I said: If someone casts doubt upon what they believed prior was God’s word based on weak claims, it would be an awful message on the stability of a believer’s faith. As the claims so far has been weak or unpresented, I am led to think that is the case.

And if the Bible is so authoritative, then why did God wait until a couple hundred years ago to reveal it?

The answer to this is the same to God’s “delay” in answering prayers and the like. It simply wouldn’t achieve His goal, or would achieve it in a subpar quality. Asking questions like “Couldn’t God just constantly form “I am God” in the clouds to make everyone know of his existence” ignores the extremely limited sight of human beings.

As for sacrifices, why does the Psalm author say he would bring a sacrifice if God had pleasure in it? Yet the Torah specifically requires a sacrifice as atonement for sin, and claims it pleases God because of a "savory aroma". Every other place God looks favorably on sacrifice is as a thank you, like a Lent type thing, as you admit that he condemns it for other reasons. Yet the Torah also prescribes it for exactly those reasons.

I haven’t argued that God isn’t pleased with sacrifice. I said specifically, “and as God is pleased with us asking for forgiveness today, sacrifice was a method to repent when one fails God’s commands”. When has the Torah prescribed sacrifice for ignoring God’s commands?

parent.body:
> They were plucking grain on the Sabbath. I doubt they were just picking it off and eating it raw. 

No disagreement. As said prior, food isn’t a work related concept.

> Jesus's comment implies the original commandment was more about not making other people work more than 6 days a week.

The claim was “Man was created, then the Sabbath was created as a day to cease working, in remembrance of God ceasing the creation of the universe on the seventh day.” This isn’t mutually exclusive with God not wanting people to work more than 6 days a week.

> And the Old Testament absolutely does condone judging and hating one's enemy in many instances. It's even infamous for it, especially the Pentateuch. Jesus however has ministry activities far outside of Jewish peoples into enemy territory, much to the dismay of the Pharisees and Sadducees who were too proud of their heritage. Judging by his actions he does not seems like someone who would say "love your enemy" but actually mean "you can still hate your enemy".

I maintain that the Old Testament does not condone hating one’s enemy. What parts are you referring to?

> Jesus's golden rule directly contradicts much of both testaments. And I don't think it's a coincidence that those tend to be exactly the parts that seem like they were added later by some scribe.

I maintain that this is untrue. As to the New Testament as well, what parts are you referring to?
parent.body_html:
They were plucking grain on the Sabbath. I doubt they were just picking it off and eating it raw.

No disagreement. As said prior, food isn’t a work related concept.

Jesus's comment implies the original commandment was more about not making other people work more than 6 days a week.

The claim was “Man was created, then the Sabbath was created as a day to cease working, in remembrance of God ceasing the creation of the universe on the seventh day.” This isn’t mutually exclusive with God not wanting people to work more than 6 days a week.

And the Old Testament absolutely does condone judging and hating one's enemy in many instances. It's even infamous for it, especially the Pentateuch. Jesus however has ministry activities far outside of Jewish peoples into enemy territory, much to the dismay of the Pharisees and Sadducees who were too proud of their heritage. Judging by his actions he does not seems like someone who would say "love your enemy" but actually mean "you can still hate your enemy".

I maintain that the Old Testament does not condone hating one’s enemy. What parts are you referring to?

Jesus's golden rule directly contradicts much of both testaments. And I don't think it's a coincidence that those tend to be exactly the parts that seem like they were added later by some scribe.

I maintain that this is untrue. As to the New Testament as well, what parts are you referring to?

Humans are a herd and tournament species, meaning their behavior is inherently violent, group-minded, hierarchical, collectivist, and conformist, and biological determinism plays a big role. Humans feel the best when they have established dominance or punished an enemy they've dehumanized. They need that feeling of "the enemy" to take down and obliterate, and a blind loyalty to their own clan and its leaders. This is why nearly every argument has two black-and-white sides with nearly zero middle-ground; 99% of people do not arrive at such conclusions by their own merit, but through loyalty to their tribe and hatred of "the enemy" one. And if any middle ground ever does exist, it is not recognized; both sides will merely attribute it to the other one. This is not how the real world works, this is how human instincts think it does. The excessive violence and authoritarianism of humans is explained by the ultimate desire to crush and obliterate whoever "the enemy" is, even when doing so is completely pointless. And unfortunately, the desire to identify an enemy to destroy is ever-present, meaning that even if there is no real conflict, humans will find an enemy in something silly or at worst, innocent, out of desperation to quench this instinct.

Within their tribes, humans love collectivism and defined social organization. Everyone follows pre-defined stereotypes and roles so it's easy to make all your judgements about someone by looking at them. Our bodies and brains develop in certain ways to fulfill these social roles. If someone falls out of line, it must be dealt with. If they do not oblige, they are disloyal and must be part of "the enemy". Individualism is tolerated to a degree but only when it's beneficial to the tribe. A good example is how women are afforded much greater freedom with their lives than men because they always have "I can bear children" to fall back on. Whether they intend to or not, or are even able to, humans make quick judgements based on what they see and will assume that she is fulfilling her social duty that way whether it's true or not. Men, however, must prove their loyalty and benefit to the tribe with actions and achievements, or they will immediately stand out as individuals among the brainwashed collective.

Anyone on the outside looking in would be horrified. Even the freest possible human community is very close to communism in absolute terms. Humans on a fundamental level are no different than horses or wolves or other herd animals who are defined by their membership in a collective and aren't allowed to have any life or mind of their own. It's just that these herds manifest in a much larger and more powerful scale in humans.

parent.body:
Oh hell nah, thats just wrong.

Collectivism is a taught idea. I grew up in the 90's and tv shows were pushing that you had to make yourself a unique asset to the world.
But had i been born in china or russia I wouldnt have had that sort of influence.

I had to learn to mingle with normal society, i had made myself even more of a black sheep than I was and "normal" felt alien.

I was better without caring about the world around me. But that was ignoring the problems, not having relationships, attachments responsibilities. Ignorance was bliss, not giving a shit meant I didnt know, didnt care to know. Now i gotta pretend im a normal responsible adult.

I hate it, people praise me all the time. Im not good at what i do. Im a 6/10

It is not my fault if the standards of society have fallen and  mediocrity is rewarded with praise. But it wont change unless people are told this, so i tell them.

body: The data proves the grass is quite a bit greener on the other side. Women are happier than men everywhere in the world, including where they're truly oppressed. The only conclusion, then, is that their internal chemistry serves them a lot better and men simply *are not capable* of self-actualization regardless of external circumstances. This does make sense biologically, as females are from the ground up built for aesthetic and pleasure, periods and sometimes breasts being the only exceptions. Males are built for utility and performance, and being happy would hinder the skills their bodies are developing for, they are much more useful to the tribe when deppressed and angry. We see this socially too: women have their individuality rewarded and are almost never criticized or held to a standard; men are expected to sacrifice everything they have and endure large amounts of stress and pain for their society. In prehistoric times this meant hard labor, going to war, competing for mates, and defending their tribe. Today it's exactly the same, only with technology and domestication thrown in to make it a lot more subtle. Autism is usually missed in women because it's not "wrong" for them to behave that way. Men are expected to be very invested in their society and not have much of a life of their own. Basically male expendability is 100% correct and explains almost everything. Opposing gender arguments on both sides of the culture wars all ultimately turn out to be rooted in exactly this.

body:
> At some point we as a collective must just want it so.

That will NEVER happen. Living as an individual is against every fiber of fundamental human behavior. 99% of people NEED to be part of a clan and groupthink, it's how herd species work. They must either be following or commanding, "live and let live" is the most anti-human value you can have. And they need a main enemy to scapegoat and feel glorious about defeating. Those of us missing this herd instinct are nearly always weighed down with a whole bunch of mental disorders, meaning we are wildly far off of "healthy" human development. Which makes sense, seeing as we behave almost exactly the opposite of them. I would call being able to see past this bullshit a plus, but it also means you're practically your own species trapped in the body of something else, and forced to live as one of them since they won't tolerate no dissent, and even your own body forces you to develop down a path that's best for them and against you.

It's just nature, it will never change, and we're unfortunate enough to not have the blissful ignorance and group identity that we're supposed to and we have to live with it. When it's 1% against the 99% it's barely a question who's going to win, who is good or bad doesn't matter.

The excessive violence and authoritarianism of humans is explained by the ultimate desire to crush and obliterate whoever "the enemy" is, even when doing so is completely pointless. And unfortunately, the desire to identify an enemy to destroy is ever-present, meaning that even if there is no real conflict, humans will find an enemy in something silly or at worst, innocent, out of desperation to quench this instinct.

Within their tribes, humans love collectivism and defined social organization. Everyone follows pre-defined stereotypes and roles so it's easy to make all your judgements about someone by looking at them. Our bodies and brains develop in certain ways to fulfill these social roles. If someone falls out of line, it must be dealt with. If they do not oblige, they are disloyal and must be part of "the enemy". Individualism is tolerated to a degree but only when it's beneficial to the tribe. A good example is how women are afforded much greater freedom with their lives than men because they always have "I can bear children" to fall back on. Whether they intend to or not, or are even able to, humans make quick judgements based on what they see and will assume that she is fulfilling her social duty that way whether it's true or not. Men, however, must prove their loyalty and benefit to the tribe with actions and achievements, or they will immediately stand out as individuals among the brainwashed collective.

Anyone on the outside looking in would be horrified. Even the freest possible human community is very close to communism in absolute terms. Humans on a fundamental level are no different than horses or wolves or other herd animals who are defined by their membership in a collective and aren't allowed to have any life or mind of their own. It's just that these herds manifest in a much larger and more powerful scale in humans.
post.title: Neurotypicals can't be satisfied without tyranny because humans are a herd species

> So are you going to fully concede to your supposed role, or are you going to be your own man?

I can't, because I'm stuck with a brain that won't let me because it developed against it. Men have to lose all their original abilities and feelings to specialize in skills that benefit the tribe. Women do not because their only real role is to have babies. Women can be themselves by choosing to or to not have children, because they keep the default brain and the default body. Men have everything renovated to specialize in specific skills and lose basically everything else. It's supposed to also make you eager to fulfill that role but it must've broken on me and now I'm depressed and lost. I have to either pretend to be something I'm not inside or pretend to be something I'm not made for. Either way I'm shooting myself in the foot.

I know this is going to sound preachy and cliche as hell, but happiness and free thought is partially a choice. Humanity, society, etc are always going to be clown world for one reason or another, but you can choose not to be that.

I'm pretty introverted irl but when I do socialize, I choose men and women who see through the bullshit and want to be better than that. People who choose not to be normies and simps.

So are you going to fully concede to your supposed role, or are you going to be your own man?

If ya'll didn't have it in you, I don't think you would be on Ruqqus.

body: I was fine with autism before I started puberty and my brain and body started specializing for crap I have absolutely no interest in doing. Now I can't feel anything but monotony and anger. I've lost all my abilities in everything I actually enjoy doing. Even my physical senses become dull. I have no creativity left. I'm nowhere near as smart. I used to be someone you'd consider gifted and talented because my brain actually worked, now it doesn't. I also have ADHD but it had a positive effect on me before, where I was hyperactive but didn't have concentration issues. Now I feel a lot more lethargic and can't focus on anything. And it's extremely irritating that women don't have to deal with any of these awful changes, and even moreso that I'm a sexist or an incel for pointing this out. It's especially bad when I see autistic women or those who are exactly like me because it really cements that this is all the result of hard luck. What I'm probably lacking in is the social reward system, which is supposed to make me want to pursue the tasks I'm developing to fulfill for my clan. Without it the sacrifice is obviously not worth it to me, and you have to admit it's a *big* sacrifice, which I had no say in. We males are just disposable and almost always get the short end of the stick from both our own flesh and society. And without any sense of group identity or responsibility it's all in vain.

Obviously you can't simply will away depression or autism anymore than I could just will away ADHD, but it's not unbeatable.
